text: Central African Republic at the Olympics is a history which includes 9 games in 8 countries and 40+ athletes.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), "Central African Republic" ; retrieved 2012-8-13. Since 1964,Olympic.org, Central African Republic; retrieved 2012-8-13. athletes of the Central African Republic have been part of the "Olympic Movement".Olympics.org, "Factsheet: The Olympic Movement"; retrieved 2012-8-13. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for the Central African Republic is CAF. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== The Central African Republic National Olympic Committee (Comit√© National Olympique et Sportif Centrafricain) was formed in 1964. It was recognized by the International Olympic Committee in 1965. The Central African Republic has been in every Summer Olympic Games held between the1984 Summer Olympics and the 2012 Summer Olympics. A team from the Central African Republic first competed in the 1968 Summer Olympics. The country has not won an Olympic medal. No athletes from the Central African Republic have been at any Winter Olympic Games. ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == ==Other websites == * Central African Republic profile at London2012.com Category:Central African Republic Category:Nations at the Olympics
title: Central African Republic at the Olympics
